channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: China blockade would be an act of war: Taiwan
item.description: China's blockaded Taiwan would be considered an act of war according to Taiwan's defense minister, Wellington Koo. This would affect international freight routes significantly. Despite concluding recent war games, Chinese military operations continue, prompting Taiwan’s defense response policy to remain firm against potential provocations by China's coast guard.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia state fends off cyberattack on absentee ballot website, state secretary office reveals
item.description: Georgia's secretary of state’s office has successfully stopped a cyberattack suspected to be from a foreign entity, targeting the absentee ballot request website. The attempt aimed to crash the system before the presidential election. Despite the attack, the site remained operational, thanks to robust cyber defenses.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Stacey Williams? Ex-model who accused Trump of groping her
item.description: Former model Stacey Williams accuses Donald Trump of groping her in the early 1990s, following an introduction by Jeffrey Epstein. The incident allegedly took place in Trump's New York office. Williams recounts feeling paralyzed and confused during the unwanted interaction. The Trump campaign dismisses the allegations as fake and politically motivated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Oooooh...I don't like my hair tonight': Trump gets distracted mid-speech at Georgia rally; see video
item.description: During a rally in Duluth, Donald Trump humorously asked for an immigration chart to be removed so he could see himself, remarking on his hair. Kamala Harris’ campaign mocked him as lost and confused. Former independent candidate Robert F Kennedy Jr joined Trump, while Harris labeled Trump a fascist at a CNN town hall.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Will the polls be right in 2024? What polling on the presidential race can and can’t tell you
item.description: National polls in presidential races are limited and not necessarily predictive, capturing opinions at a moment in time with notable margins of error. State-level polling and Electoral College considerations provide a more nuanced picture, but have their own challenges and broader margins of error.

item.title: Canada to cut immigration for first time in years amid rising political pressure
item.description: Canada plans to cap its immigration numbers, reducing new permanent residents from 485,000 in 2024 to 365,000 in 2027. This policy shift, influenced by political pressure and housing concerns, responds to public sentiment on immigration and recent diplomatic tensions with India.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel accuses 6 Al Jazeera journalists in Gaza of being Palestinian militants
item.description: The Israeli army accuses six Al Jazeera journalists of being affiliated with Palestinian militant groups, while Al Jazeera rejects the claims as fabricated. The accusations come amidst rising hostility and increasing dangers for journalists covering the ongoing conflict in Gaza. Verification of evidence is yet unconfirmed.

item.title: If North Korean soldiers join Russian army to fight Ukraine is true, it is a sign of weakness for Kremlin: White House
item.description: North Korean soldiers have traveled to Russia and could soon join the fight against Ukraine, making them legitimate military targets, according to the White House. The soldiers are receiving training in Russia, and this cooperation violates multiple UN security council resolutions. The U.S. is closely monitoring this situation and coordinating with allies on potential responses.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korean balloon filled with trash drops on South Korean Presidential compound
item.description: A North Korean balloon carrying trash and propaganda leaflets landed on South Korea's presidential compound, creating a security concern. This incident, the second in recent months, hints at North Korea's use of GPS for targeted delivery. South Korea warns that threats to its citizens could end the North Korean regime.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US Senator Graham says Israel-Saudi deal possible before year-end
item.description: US Senator Lindsey Graham believes an Israeli-Saudi normalization agreement is possible by year's end, with President Biden's support. Graham noted that the current administration is best positioned to secure congressional backing. Efforts had stalled post-Hamas attack, but there's optimism for a ceasefire in Lebanon and rebuilding Gaza with Arab countries' help.

item.title: Evidence shows 3000 North Korean troops in Russia, possibly for Ukraine war: US
Trump team accuses UK's Labour party of election meddling
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Dhaka stakeholder in Delhi's foreign policy initiatives: India envoy
Awami League's student wing is banned under anti-terror act
BNP staves off bid to remove Bangladesh president, warns of national crisis
After we hit Iran, world will understand our preparations: Yoav Gallant
Killed Safieddine, presumed Nasrallah heir, 3 weeks ago, says Israeli military
item.description: The Israeli military announced it killed Hashem Safieddine, presumed successor to Hezbollah's assassinated chief, in an air strike near Beirut weeks ago. The strike targeted a meeting of senior Hezbollah members, resulting in the deaths of more than 25 operatives.

item.title: Justice Department warns Elon Musk’s America PAC over $1 million daily giveaway
item.description: The Justice Department cautions Elon Musk’s America PAC regarding its $1 million daily giveaway in key states, citing potential federal election law violations. Legal experts are divided, but concerns persist about the legality of compensating individuals for voter registration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Texas Attorney General sues Biden-Harris admin for not verifying citizenship of 450K 'potentially ineligible' voters
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton files a lawsuit against the Biden-Harris administration, accusing it of failing to provide necessary citizenship verification for over 450,000 voter registrations. Paxton critiques the SAVE program's inadequacy and highlights federal barriers preventing proof of citizenship requirements in federal elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Turkey launches airstrikes against Kurdish militants in Iraq and Syria following 'terror attack' on Turkish aerospace firm
item.description: After an attack on Turkey's aviation company TUSAS, the Turkish air force struck Kurdish militant targets in Iraq and Syria, killing five people and destroying over 30 targets. An ongoing hostage situation was reported, coinciding with a major trade fair in Istanbul. Responsibility remains unclaimed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
